ResourceHeader.Description: The Darwin Ionosonde station near Darwin, NT, Australia, has a digital Ionosonde since August of 1994. They are IPS 4D between 08/1994, IPS 5C between 05/1995 and 10/1998, CADI in June 1999 for only 4 days and IPS 5D since 06/1999 to now. The IPS 5D vertical sounding ionosondes normally sweep in frequency from about 1 to 21.5 MHz. Frequency step resolution for the 5D is 5kHz, with up to 4095 steps available. The step interval is variable, becoming more coarse at higher frequencies as ionograms are generally displayed on a logarithmic scale. See details at http://www.sws.bom.gov.au/World_Data_Centre/2/1/3
